alert.note: Alert for Shasta; Tehama (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 14 at 7:19PM PDT until March 14 at 9:15PM PDT by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM PDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTH CENTRAL SHASTA AND NORTH CENTRAL TEHAMA COUNTIES... At 719 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated that produced very heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain had fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. An automated gauge in Whitmore reported 1.24 inches of rain in one hour. To the southwest where the storm was the most intense, Radar was indicating up to 1.80 inches of rain per hour. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Cow creek and Cottonwood creek have shown significant rises and are likely overflowing their banks in places. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include...Rural areas east of Cottonwood and Anderson and northeast of Red Bluff. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
